## Why OpenAPI?

- REST APIs are ubiquitous
- Design variation
- Open governance
- Open standards
  - Machine readable
  - Common language
  - Technology/Programming language agnostic
  - Support tooling

::: {.notes}
Open governance structure under the Linux Foundation umbrella
:::

## What does it look like?

<https://learn.openapis.org/specification/>

```{.yaml}
openapi: 3.1.0
info:
  title: Tic Tac Toe
  description: |
    This API allows writing down marks on a Tic Tac Toe board
    and requesting the state of the board or of individual squares.
  version: 1.0.0
paths:
  /board:
    get:
      summary: Get the whole board
      description: Retrieves the current state of the board and the winner.
      responses:
        "200":
          description: "OK"
          content:
            ...
```

## Architect-driven or dev-driven?

```{mermaid}
---
title: Architect-driven
config:
  theme: dark
---
flowchart LR
  A[OpenAPI Spec] -->|Generate|B(Server code)
```

```{mermaid}
---
title: Dev-driven
config:
  theme: dark
---
flowchart LR
  B(Server code)-->|Generate|A[OpenAPI Spec]
```

::: {.notes}
"Architect driven"
**Pros:** Technology agnostic, can involve non-devs
**Cons:** Horrible dev experience, harder to customize the code

"Dev driven"
**Pros:** Less context switching, retain typing
**Cons:** Need to be in the code base
:::
